page.title: 14LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS
page.content: The area is rich in farmhouses of interest to students of mediaeval and Tudor architecture.The most important is {Stiniel,}meaning Stonehall,thought to mark the transition in building technique from turf and timber to granite.It is recorded in 1224 and is little altered except for an added fireplace.{Lower Jurston }is thought to date from the same period, thatched and with an unspoilt interior.{Upper {Horselake}was probably a mediaeval barn-house, the original timbers may still be seen below Tudor additions.Bedrooms and staircase were added in the 16th.C. {Lettaford,Hole {and Collihole}are houses of note and two former longhouses exist at { {Middlecott }site of a manor in Domesday 1086, each has superb fireplaces and a bread oven.
